metadata.Title: CVE-2022-2165 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Insufficient data validation in URL formatting in Google Chrome prior to103.0.5060.53 allowed a remote attacker to perform domain spoofing via IDNhomographs via a crafted domain name.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2165` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 103.0.5060.134-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 103.0.5060.134-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 103.0.5060.134-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 103.0.5060.134-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 103.0.5060.134-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '103.0.5060.134-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
